meaningMnemonic: There are two <radical>people</radical> under a <radical>canopy</radical> on the <radical>dirt</radical>. What are they doing? It's a thing called <kanji>sit</kanji>ting. They're using the dirt as a <kanji>seat</kanji> for their butts.
readingMnemonic: You shake your head in disbelief. People can't just <kanji>sit</kanji> on dirt, in fact, according to a C<reading>za</reading>r (ざ) you met recently, they shouldn’t be sitting at all!
